original_solution_mapping.L1: He finished high school in 4-1=<<4-1=3>>3 years
original_solution_mapping.L2: It takes him 3*3=<<3*3=9>>9 years to finish tertiary education
original_solution_mapping.L3: So he spends 3+9=<<3+9=12>>12 years on this education

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 7176.
    Returns: the total years Tate spent in high school and college.
    """
    # L1
    normal_high_school_years = 4 # WK
    less_than_normal = 1 # 1 year less than normal
    high_school_years = normal_high_school_years - less_than_normal

    # L2
    multiplier_for_tertiary = 3 # 3 times that long
    tertiary_education_years = multiplier_for_tertiary * high_school_years

    # L3
    total_education_years = high_school_years + tertiary_education_years

    # FA
    answer = total_education_years
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He finished high school in {normal_high_school_years}-{less_than_normal}=<<{normal_high_school_years}-{less_than_normal}={high_school_years}>>{high_school_years} years
It takes him {multiplier_for_tertiary}*{high_school_years}=<<{multiplier_for_tertiary}*{high_school_years}={tertiary_education_years}>>{tertiary_education_years} years to finish tertiary education
So he spends {high_school_years}+{tertiary_education_years}=<<{high_school_years}+{tertiary_education_years}={total_education_years}>>{total_education_years} years on this education

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: He finished high school in 4-1=<<4-1=3>>3 years
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: It takes him 1*3=<<1*3=3>>3 years to finish tertiary education
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: So he spends 3+3=<<3+3=6>>6 years on this education

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'less_than_normal' (1) was used instead of 'multiplier_for_tertiary' (3).
